11222.content:
As much as you like your new position in life you decide to try and reverse the body switch. Your mom is now much stronger than you and she is really starting to scare you.

"Mom, you wait here. I'll go reverse it.".

"No Tim, I'm going with you. I'm going to find out how you did this and make sure it never happens again."

Reluctantly you let your mom follow you up to the attic. You see the mirror right where you left it. As soon as your mom sees the mirror, she says "Tim, where did you find this?".

"Laying right on this shelf mom. You mean you know about it?".

Your mom looks extremely pale and says "You don't understand what you have done. This mirror does allow people to switch bodies, but its results are very unpredictable and unstable. We might not be able to switch back to our own bodies, and even if we are able to something terrible might happen.".

You sit down on an old trunk, still unused to being in your mom's body, and think about what she has just told you. "What do you mean that we might not be able to switch back?".

Your mom sits down next to you, also looking like she is having a difficult time adjusting to your body, and says "My great grandmother had bought this mirror at a magic fair in Bavaria. It has remained in the family ever since. It usually allows a person to switch bodies with another person once. If they try to switch back or switch with another person it only occasionally works. Sometimes it will change both people permanently in ways they do not wish. I'd rather not go into the details.".

Looking at the seriousness on your former body's face, you know that your mom is telling the truth. For some reason you feel like crying even though you never cry. You figure it must be because you are in your mom's body and now have her hormones.

You look at your mom and say "I'm sorry mom. I didn't mean for this to happen, I didn't even know that the mirror had any special powers. When we switched bodies, I only planned on staying as you for a couple of hours. I just wanted to see what it would be like to be you.". By the time you have finished saying this you are sobbing uncontrollably.

Your mom seems to be kind of freaked out by your new emotional personality but she puts an arm around you and says 'It's okay honey, I realize you meant no harm. We do have a decision to make though - do we switch back and risk some horrible consequences or do we now live each other's lives?".

You both decide to...........

114211.content:
You are completely weirded out by the whole discovery of this mirror and its strange capabilities. You decide to weird out your mom by going up and talking to her while you are inhabiting an exact replica of your body.

As she sees you walking over to her, she smiles and says "Hi Tim. I see that your found the mirror.".

You start stuttering and stammering "You, you, you mean you know about the mirror?".

"Yes, and I left it in a place where I was sure you would find it.".

"You mean that you wanted me to turn into you mom?".

Your mom smiles and says "Yes, but we need to talk. I'm not really your mom, well I have been acting like her for the last 6 months.....". You interrupt her, "What do you mean you're not my mom?".

The woman you thought was your mom starts back up "Let me start from the beginning. My name is Tyrabitha Plagintoo, I am an intergalactic detective from the planet Cyraseene. I have been assigned to your planet Earth. One technology we have developed is the ability to morph both ourselves and Earthlings into other people. Unfortunately we are only able to perform one morph on humans, than they are stuck into whatever we morph them into for the rest of their lives. I needed your mom's body in order to catch an escaped fugitive who was posing as her hairstylist.".

Again you interupt "Well where is she now?". Tyrabitha replies "She is now a 45 year old man who works as a guidance counselor at a high school in Ohio. Don't worry, she is fine, but unfortunately she is stuck in that life. She is happy, but she does remember you, yours sister and your dad and she misses you.".

You find this story almost too incredible to be true, yet at the same time you know that she is telling the truth. Tyrabitha starts back up "Anyways, whenever we need to pose as a person, that person then morphs into the last person we used. We need to pose as you, so that is why you became your mom.".

You protest "Wait a minute. I want to help you catch criminals, but you just can't steal my life like this.". Tyrabitha replies "Well they all say that at first, but soon you will find that you will really enjoy your new life.". She points a device at you and says "This will allow you to retain your memories of you being you, but at the same time will make you think and act more like your mom, or I should say - the new you. In a few days, no one will be able to tell that you are not your mom. You will talk, act, dress, everything else just like her, and you will be happy about it."

Tyrabitha then pulls out a mirror and looks into it. In a few seconds she looks exactly like you did before you found the mirror. She says "I need to to go to another state in your old body in order to catch the next criminal. Do not try to follow me.". Then in a flash of light she disappears.

You already feel yourself thinking more like your mom. Do you.......
114211.title: Intergalactic Detective

1531.content:
Tim started to freak out. He didn't know what to do. He looked exactly like his sister Julie, and his girlfriend Sarah looked exactly like he used to look. Finally, his sister looked like his girlfriend.

But before he could concentrate and make something out of his situation, he heard the doorbell ring.

"What have I done?" he said to himself. He knew it would be strange wearing any of his sister's clothes, but girls could easily get away with wearing things that weren't necessarily girly. Tim ran into his room and threw a sweatshirt on along with some jeans, though he also put on a belt to hold them up. The clothes were too big for him, but he needed to get to the door.

Just as he heads down the stairs, his mother opens the door. "Tim?" she said curiously, "Why are you ringing the bell?" Tim, in Julie's body, quickly ran back up the stairs and hid.

Sarah stood in the doorway, but her appearance was that of Tim's former self. "Uh... because... Julie wasn't getting up," Sarah said with a smirk, not unlike how Tim would act.

"Come now, Tim. That's just rude. And why do you need Julie up? I can get her up if you really...really need her."

"No, no. That's fine. I'm just playing."

Tim's mother smiled. "Well, next time don't be so loud on a Saturday morning."

"Sorry," Sarah said.

His mother walked off into the kitchen, while Sarah ran upstairs. But as she looked to the right, Julie sat there against the wall. "Hey... Julie... do you... well, that would said weird. Would it?" she thought out loud.

"Sarah!" Tim said, with a faint sound of stress, "I'm Tim."

"Wait... wah... what? How can this happen? First thing I'm you... and now you're your sister."

"...And my sister is you." He paused. "It might sound strange, but I found this mirror in my attic... and it must be magic." He looked around. "Let's head to my room. Let me explain there."
1531.title: Facade

choices: Test the mirror to try and correct this easily...
15311.content:
Tim and Sarah entered Tim's bedroom, both a little freaked out over what has happened. Sarah sat in the corner, looking as if she could cry any moment. But she held back. She could hardly curl up like she normally does because Tim's body was unsuited to stretching. But she knew something would happen. She liked Tim for his decisiveness and planning. She liked his strength of mind.

Tim laid back on his bedsheets. His new dirty-blonde hair laid strewn over his bed. It felt a bit awkward for him, since his bed was often a place of some comfort to him. But now he felt out of place. His body was now his sister's, and, even though they were only a year apart, his sister was 5'4", almost half a foot smaller than he was. His feet, much smaller than before, couldn't reach the floor if he sat on the edge of his bed. Finally, his breasts were out of place, especially without a bra on to hold them.

On the plus side, he weighed about 55 pounds less, and he could easily feel it.

"You see Sarah, I woke up early this morning and was incredibly bored. I didn't feel like doing anything. It was weird."

"Weirder than this?" Sarah said, interested.

"No." He let out a chuckle, though, coming from his sister's body, just made everything weirder. "But I looked through things in my attic... something to do, ya know? Nah, I'd never do that normally. Anywho, I found a mirror under a pile of clothing. I saw a dress on the floor and instantly thought of your white dress from the prom."

"Awwww..." Sarah said, though Tim gave her a wierd look. He knew he'd never say that. "You thought about me in your free time?" She looked a bit happier.

"When would I not?" Tim said, in a strange effort to charm. "But, back to the story. I picked up the mirror instinctivly, as it out of my control. As I did, I closed my eyes. I couldn't keep them open. And... when I looked at the mirror again, I saw you. But it wasn't a picture. I was looking at myself. Rather... myself looking like you. You must have changed at the same time."

"Yeah, I woke up only ten minutes before it happened," Sarah explained. "I got out of bed and got into my shower. As I finished my shower and started to dry myself, I also had to blink. When I opened my eyes, my body felt strange. I was you, but when I found that out in the mirror, I slipped and fell in the bathroom. I quickly ran into my room, locked the door, and heard my cell ring."

"And that's when I called."

"Yeah."

"Damn, see... it's more complicated then that. In the meantime, I tried to think of someone who could help. And... well, I thought of my sister. But... and I have to be an idiot... I was holding the mirror. So five seconds later and I'm her. I go to check in her room and I see her still asleep, but now she has your old body. That was maybe ten minutes ago."

"What time is it now?"

"10:32," Tim said as he looked at his digital clock next to his bed. He sat up and gave a rundown of the situation. "Well... Tim..." he exphasized, "I don't normally wake up this early." He reverted back to his more serious tone, even though he didn't know how to do it for his sister since his sister had a much lighter voice. "I think Julie went to bed after I did, and I went to bed around midnight. She was talking late last night, so I'd expect her going to bed around 2:00 AM. She likes her 10-hour beauty sleeps, so I'd give her about an hour and a half before she wakes up. We have to get to her before mom does, or things will get even more awkward."

"Then what should we do?" Sarah said.
15311.title: Backstory explanation

153111.content:
"Let's go get Julie up," Tim suggested. "By God, I wanted her help. I might as well get it."

"But... what if she screams. It would be a very strange situation. Your mom would run up and see Julie and Tim standing around me in Julie's bed, screaming."

"...Yeah." He pictured it, and it would be hard to explain. "Well, we can muffle her voice with a pillow."

"Isn't that dangerous?"

"Well, what other choice do we have?" he joked. He got up and walked quietly into Julie's room. Her room was cluttered to the brim with old toys, dolls, clothes, and whatnot. Being very attached to things, she didn't like throwing stuff away. Her shades were closed for the night since she was scared of the dark trees outside.

Tim pulled open the shades as Sarah closed the door. Bright light poured in from the sun and made Julie wake up. She was used to a female body, so nothing seemed out of the ordinary. But what was out of the ordinary was her body wearing a sweatshirt and baggy jeans, and her brother wearing some old clothes. Both were staring at her as she awoke. "What is this?" she said... but her voice was different. Tired though she was, she noticed the slight difference. She sat up quickly.

Julie's body began speaking, "Julie... I know you're tired, but you have to listen to me. You can't be loud. I'm actually Tim, and well, you're Sarah."

"What... what?" She looked around and saw her body, now more awake then ever. Her skin was a shade darker... not enough that anybody would notice, but enough that comparing them side by side would make it obvious. Her hair, now a little bit longer, went down a little past her shoulders, compared to her old hair which was often just barely to her shoulders. It was also a brown now, much darker than it normally was. This was Sarah's body all right.

"Julie," Tim began, "we found this magic mirror that allows you to change your body. But I accidentally changed my body into your when I wanted help. And I changed mine into Sarah's before that. I'm trying to fix this."

Julie... though feeling strange, had to think rationally. "Well, why didn't you use the mirror to change back. What other options would you have? I'm not an expert in magic."

"But then you could just look at the mirror and switch back."

"Well, good point." Tim agreed with her plan, even if it meant being the last one to switch. "Take the mirror."

"...Uh, where is it?" Sarah said, confused.

"Damn, stupid me. It must be upstairs, back in the attic." They both ran upstairs and looked around.

Sarah looked at something glimmering on the ground, on top of a pile of clothes. "Tim, I found it!" she said excitedly.

"Good, now think of my sister."

She thought of his sister, and as she did, they both blinked. But the outcome was a bit of a mistake. When she opened her eyes, she was still wearing Tim's clothes, but now her body was that of Julie's... and Tim's body was again his own. "Wait... what happened?"

"My mistake." He laughed, glad to be in his own body again. He loosened his belt so that it fit well again. "Just think of your own body this time."

Sarah did as Tim said, and just like that they both blinked again. "It worked!" she yelled. She jumped once, and let go of the mirror.

Tim lunged for the mirror as it fell to the ground. Right as it was about to hit, he saved it. "Phew," he said, with a sigh of relief.

"Wait... But Tim, why would you want it? It caused all this trouble."

"But... don't you see? This is awesome. We could experiment. We could do whatever we wanted with this!"

"But... it still caused this trouble. And what if the mirror has some ability we don't know of yet?"

"Then we discover it! This could be amazing." Tim started to sound hysterical.

"Then, let's go to my place with it," Sarah suggested.

"Sure!"
